post_text: Beginning September 1, 2020, free breakfast and lunch will be provided for all Cordell Public School students. Due to COVID, this is a special provision provided by the United States Department of Agriculture and is a temporary program that will last until the federal funding runs out. We encourage all students to take advantage of a free wonderful, well-balanced meal.
text: Beginning September 1, 2020, free breakfast and lunch will be provided for all Cordell Public School students. Due to COVID, this is a special provision provided by the United States Department of Agriculture and is a temporary program that will last until the federal funding runs out. We encourage all students to take advantage of a free wonderful, well-balanced meal.

post_text:
At today's state Board of Education meeting, the board decided not to enact any new mandates regarding face coverings, school building access by students, staff or the public, instructional delivery or extracurricular activities.

However, the board did agree to provide health and safety protocol recommendations to districts as guidance. The recommendations were tied to the state's color-coded COVID-19 alert system, which is updated on a weekly basis.

Cordell Schools is in the process of reviewing these guidelines and will communicate our expectations soon.
text:
At today's state Board of Education meeting, the board decided not to enact any new mandates regarding face coverings, school building access by students, staff or the public, instructional delivery or extracurricular activities.

However, the board did agree to provide health and safety protocol recommendations to districts as guidance. The recommendations were tied to the state's color-coded COVID-19 alert system, which is updated on a weekly basis.

Cordell Schools is in the process of reviewing these guidelines and will communicate our expectations soon.

July 15 at 4:57 PM ·

Cordell Schools will host a community meeting on Tuesday, July 21st at 7:00p.m. in the Cordell Auditorium to discuss the upcoming school year. The reopening plan for the district will be presented and discussed. Ideas and thoughts from community members are welcomed and will be considered before the plan is finalized.

post_text:
If your student was in the 10th grade during the 2019-20 school year and you anticipate that your 2020 income may be under the $55,000 application limit for the Oklahoma’s Promise scholarship due to recent reductions in your income, you may submit an application based on your 2020 estimated income.

The application must be submitted prior to the June 30, 2020 deadline at https://secure.okcollegestart.org/applications/Oklahoma_Promise/apply.html

You will be required to provide a copy of your 2020 federal tax return when completed to verify that your 2020 income was under $55,000. The application will be held as pending until the tax documentation is received. Please send any questions to okpromise@osrhe.edu.
text:
If your student was in the 10th grade during the 2019-20 school year and you anticipate that your 2020 income may be under the $55,000 application limit for the Oklahoma’s Promise scholarship due to recent reductions in your income, you may submit an application based on your 2020 estimated income.

The application must be submitted prior to the June 30, 2020 deadline at https://secure.okcollegestart.org/applications/Oklahoma_Promise/apply.html

You will be required to provide a copy of your 2020 federal tax return when completed to verify that your 2020 income was under $55,000. The application will be held as pending until the tax documentation is received. Please send any questions to okpromise@osrhe.edu.

SECURE.OKCOLLEGESTART.ORG
Oklahoma's Promise � Introduction

post_text:
Cordell Public Schools will be offering Driver’s Education for Cordell Public School Students this summer.

The class will begin on Monday, June 29, and run through Thursday, July 2 from 8 am to 4:30 pm each day. The students will have a 1 hour lunch break each day. Students will need to attend class each day and stay the entire class time. Please arrange your calendar to avoid missing any part of the class instruction!!!

*******STUDENTS must be 15 years old by June 29*******

Tentative driving will begin July 6 and run through July 18 depending on the number of students enrolled.

Cost will be $ 100 per student. Make checks payable to Cordell Public Schools upon enrollment on Monday, June 29.

If you have any questions, email David Garmon at dgarmon@cordell.k12.ok.us
or call Paul Pankhurst @ 580-832-1002

Zane Trammell
May 31 at 5:07 PM ·

Football Summer Workouts
Reminder: Summer weights start tomorrow morning (6/1/20) at 6:00a.m. for all 9th-12th graders and 7:30a.m. for 7th&8th graders.
Due to Covid, athletes need to provide their own water and will not have access to the locker rooms (show up ready to go). Masks will be provided for those interested, along with other precautions.
Strength and Conditioning sessions could be subject to change moving forward in the future due to Covid.

Please share.

post_text:
Congratulation Cloie Banks!!!

SWOSU President’s Leadership Class selected

Seventeen high school seniors, including Weatherford senior Hannah Dirickson and Hydro-Eakly senior Brooklynn Kimble, have been selected for the President’s Leadership Class (PLC) for 2020-21 at Southwestern Oklahoma State University in Weatherford.

Members of the class and their high schools are:
•Hanna Dirickson, Weatherford
•Brooklynn Kimble, Hydro-Eakly
•Cloie Banks, Cordell
•Matthew Beck, Stroud
•Harley Brinkley, Clinton
•Raegan Cope, Altus
•Lathanise Cox-Moscatello, Moore
•Lincoln Fitts, Duncan
•Andrew Houk, Fairview
•Emiley Kauk, Arapaho-Butler
•Kohl Kimmel, Yukon
•Jaedyn Magness, Shattuck
•Matthew “Blaine”…

post_text:
Please view the following information concerning COVID-19:

Dear Cordell Community:

On Monday, March 16, 2020, the State Board of Education voted to close all Oklahoma schools, effective immediately, until at least April 6 in an effort to minimize the spread of COVID-19.

This includes Cordell Public Schools. There will be no school activities and all school facilities will be closed during this time.

Oklahoma schools are not expected to be required to make-up the missed days. At this time, schools have been instructed by the State Department of Education not to provide online, home-based or distance learning for students.

Communication will be key during the next two weeks. It is our hope…
text:
Please view the following information concerning COVID-19:

Dear Cordell Community:

On Monday, March 16, 2020, the State Board of Education voted to close all Oklahoma schools, effective immediately, until at least April 6 in an effort to minimize the spread of COVID-19.

This includes Cordell Public Schools. There will be no school activities and all school facilities will be closed during this time.

Oklahoma schools are not expected to be required to make-up the missed days. At this time, schools have been instructed by the State Department of Education not to provide online, home-based or distance learning for students.

Communication will be key during the next two weeks. It is our hope…

post_text:
Cordell Public Schools is pleased to announce our newest board member, Mr. Nocona Cook. Mr. Cook graduated in 2004 from Cordell Public Schools and from Southwestern Oklahoma State University with a degree in Business Management in 2009.

Nocona and his wife Jordan have two sons, Denton and Baylor. Denton is currently in Mrs. Power’s first-grade class, and Baylor is two.

Mr. Cook is co-owner and operator of Cook Farms, which is a substantial farming business in Washita County and includes raising wheat, cotton and stocker cattle. He also owns a custom and hay business. Mr. and Mrs. Cook are involved in a registered Angus cattle business where they raise and sell registered Angus bulls for…
text:
Cordell Public Schools is pleased to announce our newest board member, Mr. Nocona Cook. Mr. Cook graduated in 2004 from Cordell Public Schools and from Southwestern Oklahoma State University with a degree in Business Management in 2009.

Nocona and his wife Jordan have two sons, Denton and Baylor. Denton is currently in Mrs. Power’s first-grade class, and Baylor is two.

Mr. Cook is co-owner and operator of Cook Farms, which is a substantial farming business in Washita County and includes raising wheat, cotton and stocker cattle. He also owns a custom and hay business. Mr. and Mrs. Cook are involved in a registered Angus cattle business where they raise and sell registered Angus bulls for…

post_text:
ACT fees paid for by Cordell Public Schools
Cordell Public Schools will pay for the ACT test for all juniors and seniors taking the exam this upcoming February. Sixty-seven Cordell High School students will take the ACT District test on February 25th. The goal of this initiative is two-fold: help students gain access to scholarships and prevent students from needing remedial courses in college.
text:
ACT fees paid for by Cordell Public Schools
Cordell Public Schools will pay for the ACT test for all juniors and seniors taking the exam this upcoming February. Sixty-seven Cordell High School students will take the ACT District test on February 25th. The goal of this initiative is two-fold: help students gain access to scholarships and prevent students from needing remedial courses in college.

post_text: Cordell Public Schools received the Volkswagen Settlement Trust Grant for Alternative Fuel School Buses. The total cost of a new bus is $85,209 each. According to the grant stipulations, Cordell Schools will purchase 3 new buses for a cost of $130,000, and the grant will pay $125,000. This is approximately 50% of the cost of a new alternative fuel bus, which will benefit our school district greatly.
text: Cordell Public Schools received the Volkswagen Settlement Trust Grant for Alternative Fuel School Buses. The total cost of a new bus is $85,209 each. According to the grant stipulations, Cordell Schools will purchase 3 new buses for a cost of $130,000, and the grant will pay $125,000. This is approximately 50% of the cost of a new alternative fuel bus, which will benefit our school district greatly.

post_text:
On Tuesday our Cross Country team traveled to Walters for a meet.

Kobi Cameron placed 24th and ran her fastest time ever!!! Four of our 6th graders placed and Rylee Chagollia placed 1st!!

So proud of our Blue Devils!!!
